mdRecord.dcterms:title: Expense Account, from George Town to New York, [1789][May].
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Lewis, Robert, 1769-1829
mdRecord.dcterms:description: An account of ferry and inn expenses listing all the stops between Georgetown and New York--carriage of a trunk from Philadelphia to New York--stage horses--Col. Van Horn who arranged the trip had been paid earlier some amount--. Silked document, one page, in hand of Robert Lewis, watermark (MW & a plough), endorsed on back, "An account of Money's Expended from Geo. Town To New Yorke. The Amount of every expence is Â£67.10.7 Pensylvania currency."
